Based on the reduction potentials given in the table above, which of the following gives the balanced chemical equation and the correct standard cell potential for a galvanic cell involving <math alttext="S c with a positive 3 charge aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Sc</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="M n with a positive 2 charge aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Mn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="2 S c with a positive 3 charge aqueous plus 3 M n solid are in equilibrium with 2 S c solid plus 3 M n with a positive 2 charge aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Sc</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Mn(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>⇄</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Sc(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Mn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="E naught equals negative 0.90 volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.90</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
